description: Nongkran Daks is a Thai chef with over 10 years of experience. She is the owner and head chef of the Thai Basil restaurant in Chantilly, Virginia. Her passion for Thai cuisine stems from her upbringing in Thailand where she learned to cook from her mother and grandmother.

recipes.cooking_method:
1. Boil water in a pot. Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and galangal.
2. Add chilies and cook for 1 minute.
3. Add shrimp and cook until pink.
4. Add fish sauce and lime juice. Serve hot.

1. Soak rice noodles in water until soft. Drain.
2. Heat oil in a wok. Add shrimp and tofu.
3. Push the shrimp and tofu to the side of the wok. Crack the eggs in the center and scramble.

1. Heat coconut milk in a pan. Add green curry paste.
2. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink.
3. Add eggplant and bamboo shoots. Cook until tender.

description: Som Tum is a Thai chef based in Bangkok. She has over 12 years of experience in cooking and specializes in Northeastern Thai cuisine. She is known for her expertise in making papaya salad.

recipes.cooking_method:
1. Peel and shred green papaya. Set aside.
2. Pound chilies and garlic in a mortar and pestle.
3. Add green papaya, fish sauce, and palm sugar. Toss everything together.

1. Brown ground pork in a pan. Drain.
2. Add mint leaves, shallots, and lime juice.
3. Sprinkle roasted rice powder. Toss everything together.
4. Serve with lettuce leaves.

1. Heat curry paste in a pot. Add chicken and cook until browned.
2. Add coconut milk and simmer until chicken is tender.
3. Boil egg noodles until cooked. Drain.

description: Duangporn Songvisava is a Thai chef based in Bangkok. He has over 15 years of experience in cooking and is the co-founder of Bo.lan, a restaurant that specializes in Thai cuisine made from locally-sourced ingredients.

recipes.cooking_method:
1. Brown pork belly in a pot. Set aside.
2. Cook shallots, garlic, and dried chilies in the same pot.
3. Add pork belly, water, and tamarind paste. Simmer until pork is tender.

1. Cook mushrooms in a pot.
2. Add shallots, lemongrass, and mint leaves.
3. Season with fish sauce and lime juice.
4. Serve hot or cold.

1. Boil pork ribs, lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves in water.
2. Add chilies and fish sauce.
3. Serve hot with lime wedges.

description: Ian Kittichai is a Thai celebrity chef who has over 20 years of experience in cooking. He is known for his modern take on Thai cuisine and has worked in several Michelin-starred restaurants around the world.

recipes.cooking_method:
1. Cook chicken in a pan. Set aside.
2. Cook green curry paste in a pot. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil.
3. Add chicken, eggplant, and kaffir lime leaves.

1. Shred green papaya and carrots.
2. Pound chili, garlic, and palm sugar in a mortar.
3. Add fish sauce, lime juice, and shrimp paste. Mix well.
4. Add shredded vegetables, and cherry tomatoes.

1. Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes.
2. Cook beef in a pan. Set aside.
3. Cook broccoli in the same pan. Add noodles, dark soy sauce, and oyster sauce.

description: Pim Techamuanvivit is a Thai chef who owns the Kin Khao restaurant in San Francisco. She has been cooking for over 15 years and is known for her authentic Thai flavors.

recipes.cooking_method:
1. Boil coconut milk in a pot. Add lemongrass, galangal, and lime leaves. Boil for 5 minutes.
2. Add chicken and cook until it is cooked through.
3. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Cook chicken in a pan. Set aside.
2. Cook yellow curry paste in a pot. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil.
3. Add chicken and noodles. Simmer until noodles are cooked.

1. Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes.
2. Cook shrimp in a pan. Set aside.
3. Cook tofu and bean sprouts in the same pan. Add noodles and stir-fry until noodles are cooked.

description: Pailin Chongchitnant is a Thai chef and author who has over 10 years of experience in cooking. He is known for her YouTube cooking channel 'Hot Thai Kitchen' and has published a cookbook of the same name.

recipes.cooking_method:
1. Boil water in a pot. Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and galangal.
2. Add shrimp and cook until pink.
3. Add chili peppers, fish sauce, and lime juice. Simmer for a few minutes.

1. Cook beef in a pan. Set aside.
2. Cook potatoes in the same pan. Set aside.
3. Cook massaman curry paste in a pot. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil.
4. Add beef and potatoes.

1. Soak sticky rice in water for at least 2 hours.
2. Steam the rice until cooked.
3. Cook coconut milk, palm sugar, and salt in a pot.
4. Serve the rice with sliced mango
